greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Invert blocks of three in the sequence of natural numbers.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,0,1,-1).
formula: a(n) = 3*floor((n+2)/3) - (n-1) mod 3. - _Robert G. Wilson v_ and _Zak Seidov_, Jan 20 2006
a(n) = a(n-3)+3 = a(n-1)+a(n-3)-a(n-4). [_Jaume Oliver Lafont_, Dec 02 2008]
a(n) = n - 2*A049347(n). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Sep 27 2017, simplified Jun 30 2020
mathematica: f[n_] := Switch[ Mod[n, 3], 0, n - 2, 1, n + 2, 2, n]; Array[f, 72] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 18 2006 *)
LinearRecurrence[{1, 0, 1, -1}, {3, 2, 1, 6}, 100] (* or *) CoefficientList[Series[(3 - x - x^2 + 2 x^3) / ((1 + x + x^2) (1 - x)^2), {x, 0, 80}], x] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 28 2017 *)
program: (MAGMA) I:=[3,2,1,6]; [n le 4 select I[n] else Self(n-1)+Self(n-3)-Self(n-4): n in [1..80]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 28 2017
results.author: Parag D. Mehta (pmehta23(AT)gmail.com), Jan 16 2006
ext: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jan 18 2006
